['Chisel', 'Pair-of-wrenches', 'Welding torch (for metalwork, which requires pairs of welders or welding rods)', 'Mitre box (used with miter saws for cutting angles in woodworking projects)', 'Dowelling jig (helps to create paired dowel holes)', 'Dado set (creates matching dadoes, often used together)', 'Drill press (often comes as a pair or kit with drills and bits for precise work)', 'Sawdust (byproduct of cutting wood in pairs using saws)', "Carpenter's square (used to measure 90-degree angles, often used in conjunction with other tools)", 'Peg bar clamp (can be a pair for holding two pieces together)', 'Framing nail gun (for driving pairs of framing nails quickly and efficiently)', 'Jamb saw (used to cut door frames, often paired in projects requiring precise joinery)', 'Biscuit joiner (creates biscuits for joining wood together, typically used alongside a matching slug gun or dado set)', 'Plunge router (can be used with various bits to create pairs of grooves or profiles on wood surfaces)', 'Two-man saw (a small hand saw designed for use by two people simultaneously)', 'Drywall knife (used in pairs for taping and finishing drywall joints)', 'Clamp set (often includes various clamps that work together to hold pieces while glue dries or when assembling)', 'Twin-bladed router bit (creates two parallel cuts, useful for shaping wood in pairs)', 'Pair of dividers (used by carpenters to measure and mark distances on a piece of wood)', 'Combination square (a versatile tool often used in pairs to ensure accurate measurements and angles)']
